byline.contributor: Nate Schweber reported from Elmwood Park, and Benjamin Mueller from New York.
byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Michael Juskin, 100-year-old resident of Elmwood Park, NJ, kills his sleeping wife Rosalia, 88, with ax before taking his own life by cutting his wrists; Rosalia had called police twice in recent years over disputes with her husband and some had seen signs of domestic abuse, but warning signs were dismissed due to Michael's extreme old age.
lead_paragraph: There had been three 911 calls in a little over three years about erratic behavior by Michael Juskin, who killed his wife, Rosalia, and then himself on Sunday.

headline.main: Signs of Trouble Before New Jersey Centenarian Killed Wife With Ax and Took His Own Life
headline.print_headline: Signs of Trouble Before Man, 100, Killed Wife With Ax and Took His Own Life

snippet: There had been three 911 calls in a little over three years about erratic behavior by Michael Juskin, who killed his wife, Rosalia, and then himself on Sunday.
